title: Panel of Preferred Suppliers for the Provision of Trades, Specialist, Electrical ICT and General Services
agency: Issued by Mackay Regional Council
description: Mackay Regional Council is seeking a Panel of Preferred Services Providers in the areas of labour, materials, parts, equipment and supervision to carry out work on Council facilities on an as required basis. The Panel of Preferred Suppliers will include: Trade, Specialist, Electrical, Information and Communication Technology (ICT), and General Service Providers.

title: Forbes Road Causeway Replacement
agency: Issued by Mackay Regional Council
description: Mackay Regional Council is requesting suitably qualified contractors to replace the existing causeway and fishway at the O’Connell River on Forbes Road, Bloomsbury within the Mackay Regional Council area. Works include installation of a new, higher-level causeway, realignment and bitumen sealing of the approaches, including installation of a new fishway and the removal of the old causeway and fishway.

title: MECC HVAC Chiller Replacement
agency: Issued by Mackay Regional Council
description: Council is seeking submissions from suitably qualified and experienced contractors for the renewal of the existing HVAC chiller mechanical system and associated works at the Mackay Entertainment and Convention Centre, located at 258 Alfred Street, Mackay.  The scope of Services covers the provision of all works, services, and materials associated with the renewals of two (2) HVAC chiller units. Installation, and commissioning to be staged to ensure air conditioning system remains operational throughout the delivery of the project.

title: Slashing Services - Portion C - Roadside Slashing - South
agency: Issued by Sunshine Coast Council
description: Tenders are invited for slashing services required along the rural roadside network across the South zone of the Sunshine Coast Council region. Respondents are advised that the contract Slashing Services (Contract Number ITT2074) was originally released via a Public Tender in July 2021 for 16 Separable Portions. This Tender is being undertaken Portion C only as detailed below. The remaining Separable Portions are currently under Contract.

title: OIC Case Management Replacement
agency: Issued by Office of the Information Commissioner
description: The Office of the Information Commissioner (OIC) is an independent statutory body established under the Right to Information Act 2009 (RTI Act) and the Information Privacy Act 2009 (IP Act). Our statutory functions under the RTI Act and the Information Privacy Act 2009 (Qld) (IP Act) support Queensland government agencies, including departments, statutory authorities, local governments, public universities and hospital and health services, to be more open, accountable and transparent. OIC is seeking tenders for the replacement of its Case Management application which currently comprise: Matter Management application (Contact) as its Case Management System (CMS), and Other records recorded in Excel spreadsheets For detailed information on the specific goods / services sought under this tender, please review the "Specification Documents" in "Section 3 - Here is the detail".

title: CN-21311 - Flood damage restoration works to 28A Gore Highway (Toowoomba-Millmerran) Ch 0-62.92km, 28B Gore Highway (Millmerran-Goondiwindi) Ch 0-49.92km, 323 Oakey Pittsworth Road Ch 0-37.88km
agency: Issued by Department of Transport and Main Roads - Darling Downs
description: The Department of Transport and Main Roads (TMR or the “Principal”) invites prequalified Tenderers under F10 category to submit a Tender for CN -21311 for the construction of flood damage restoration works to 28A Gore Highway (Toowoomba-Millmerran) Ch 0-62.92km, 28B Gore Highway (Millmerran-Goondiwindi) Ch 0-49.92km, 323 Oakey Pittsworth Road Ch 0-37.88km To obtain documents, eligible prequalified contractors must email: dd_pc@tmr.qld.gov.au to apply for access, the relevant company ABN must be included in this email. Once approved, documentation will be made available at the BAS website: https://www.hpw.qld.gov.au/bas/etender/. Submissions are to be lodged electronically via the tender site https://www.hpw.qld.gov.au/bas/etender by 2:00pm on Tuesday 15th August 2023

title: CN21435 Asphalt Contract ? Asphalt pavement repairs and surfacing on 18C Warrego Highway (Dalby to Macalister) Ch 5.27km - Ch 23.85km
agency: Issued by Department of Transport and Main Roads - Darling Downs
description: The Department of Transport and Main Roads (TMR or the “Principal”) invites prequalified Tenderers under A4 category to submit a Tender for asphalt pavement repairs and surfacing on 18C Warrego Highway (Dalby to Macalister) Ch 5.27km - Ch 23.85km. There will not be a mandatory pre-lodgement conference for this Contract. A successful Applicant must be accredited and maintain accreditation for the duration of the project under the Australian Government Building and Construction WHS Accreditation Scheme. Compliance with the Code for Tendering and Performance of Building Work 2016 is a mandatory requirement. To obtain documents, eligible prequalified contractors must email: dd_pc@tmr.qld.gov.au to apply for access. Once approved, documentation will be made available at the BAS website: https://www.hpw.qld.gov.au/bas/etender/. Submissions are to be lodged electronically via the tender site https://www.hpw.qld.gov.au/bas/etender by 2:00pm on Tuesday 15th August 2023.

title: New State School at Redland Bay - Outside School Hours Care - OSHC
agency: Issued by Department Of Education, Training and Employment
description: Information about the opportunity This Invitation to Offer (ITO) will allow Suppliers to offer for OSHC services detailed in this ITO. title: Berrinba East State School - Block B Refurbishment & Blocks B & C Roof Replacements (with design responsibility)
agency: Issued by Department Of Education, Training and Employment
region: Building construction and support and maintenance and repair services - (50%)
description: The Department of Education (DoE) is calling for tender submissions for the refurbishment of Block B, Roof Replacement of Block B and Roof Replacement of Block C at  Berrinba East State School, located at 165 Bardon Road, Berrinba, QLD, 4117, as part of the School Infrastructure Enhancement (SIE) program and Targeted Maintenance Program (TMP). The scope comprises an internal refurbishment of B Block including new flooring, painting, electrical, joinery and minor external works. Block B and Block C require replacement of the existing roofs, including a new roof system, downpipes, galvanised shrouds and stormwater pits. The works are staged and must follow the below schedule: Block C roof replacement completed by 29th September 2023 Block B refurbishment & roof completed by 24th November 2023 Tender submissions will be accepted from contractors that meet the following requirements: Appropriate QBCC Builders licences to undertake the entire scope of works Professional Indemnity Insurance to the value of $ 1,000,000.00   Please contact Shay Lister – Project Manager on shay@honeywill.com.au with your company details and tender documentation will be emailed to contractors.  Details of the site inspection will be advised in the email and letters to tenderers.       Submissions close on 15 / 08 / 2023 at 3:00pm

title: Resource Recovery Centre Operations
agency: Issued by Sunshine Coast Council
description: Tenders are invited to operate and manage Council’s Resource Recovery Centre (RRC) services. This contract will consist of two separable portions: Separable Portion A – Resource Recovery Centres Buderim and Caloundra Separable Portion B – Resource Recovery Centres Beerwah, Witta, Mapleton, Kenilworth and Yandina Council’s objectives include to provide cost effective resource recovery operations and efficient disposal of waste, based on the waste management hierarchy and aim to minimise the amount of waste going to landfill.  The effective and successful operation of the RRCs is important in the provision of waste management services to the community.    The services to be provided at the RRCs include, but are not limited to: receive customers and assist in sorting and unloading waste segregate and prepare the residual waste for transport to landfill disposal manage bulk waste and resource stockpiles where applicable and load products   manage the site including for safety and environmental objectives manage the retail shop (recycling markets).

title: Minor Infrastructure Contract - Site 43 Exit 79 and Highfield Drive Lighting Upgrade
agency: Issued by Department of Transport and Main Roads - South Coast Region
description: Contractors are invited to tender for the Lighting upgrade at Site 43 Exit 79 and Highfield Drive and Breakwater Road. Please note that the Queensland Government Code of Practice for the Building and Construction Industry and the Queensland Procurement Policy (QPP) 2023 which includes the Ethical Supplier Threshold and Ethical Supplier Mandate applies to this project For access to Tender documentation please go directly to the QBuild (eTender) website (https://etender.hpw.qld.gov.au/public/Login.aspx) If you require assistance accessing the documents, please contact Kathy Goninan at projects.southcoast@tmr.qld.gov.au in the South Coast Regional office. Any queries regarding this offer are to be in writing and emailed to projects.southcoast@tmr.qld.gov.au. All offers must be received electronically to QBuild (eTender) by 10:00am Thursday 17 August 2023.

title: CQWW231 - 22/23 - Water Treatment Plan Residual Strategy
agency: Issued by Fraser Coast Regional Council
description: Fraser Coast Regional Council (FCRC) is seeking quotation through QTenders for the procurement of consultancy services to develop a strategy that provides recommendations for the management of water treatment residuals (WTR) produced at FCRC water treatment plants (WTPs) - the Fraser Coast Water Treatment Residuals Management Strategy (strategy).   Please be advised that quotation response forms are to be submitted as two files only and in the following format: - Non Price Quotation Response Form: PDF including all supporting documentation as one file. This PDF must not contain any price related criteria. - Price Response Quotation Form: Excel Failure to comply with this requirement may result in a non-conforming offer.

description: Noosa Shire Council invites tenders for the cleaning services for public open spaces and amenities, as described in more detail in Part 4 – Scope. This contract is structured into four (4) Separable Portions (Groups).  Respondents can submit a tender for any, multiple or all Groups. For detailed information, response documentation and submission instructions, please access Noosa Shire Council's Current Tenders website.

title: Various Schools Southwest QLD Region - Construction - Roof Replacements and associated works
agency: Issued by Department of Energy and Public Works - QBuild - Wide Bay Burnett Region
description: The Queensland Government is seeking Proposals for Various Schools Southwest QLD Region - Roof Replacement and associated works (Goondiwindi SHS - Talwood SS - Yelarbon SS) Tenderers please note: All Tenderers must hold a relevant Low, Medium or Open QBCC Builders Licence to be eligible. Tender documentation for this project is available from the QBuild Etender website at eTender - Home (hpw.qld.gov.au) Reference Number: DD7850275BLD1 Submissions are to be electronic via the QBuild etender site.

title: Expression of Interest for On Premise Backup and Recovery Solution for Operational Technology
agency: Issued by Powerlink Queensland
description: Powerlink Queensland is seeking Expressions of Interest for an On Premise Backup and Recovery Solution for Operational Technology.  Powerlink is seeking to replace an existing on premise backup, recovery and data protection solution for our Operational Technology environment. The Operational Technology environment houses all the systems and data that control, manage and support the electricity distribution network including substations, control network, control rooms and telecommunications.  As such it is a critical component of electricity distribution across Queensland. Due to the critical nature of these systems and the regulatory environment that Powerlink operates under, a cloud based solution is not appropriate and so an on premise solution housed in Powerlink data centres is required. The Expression of Interest (EOI) process constitutes the first stage of an intended two-stage procurement process.  Only successful Respondents will be subsequently provided the opportunity to submit a tender for the contract to provide the Principal’s requirements, as part of the second stage. For detailed information on the specific goods / services sought under this tender, please review the "Specification Documents" in "Section 3 - Here is the detail".

title: Provision of Performance Health Practitioner Services (Medical)
agency: Issued by Department of Tourism, Innovation and Sport
description: NOTE: The tender closing time is amended to 12pm AEST, Friday 18 August 2023. Queensland Academy of Sport (QAS is the state’s leading high-performance sport environment and supports over 600 athletes ranging from talented juniors through to Olympic, Paralympic and World Championship medallists. QAS currently provide performance support services (including health) to athletes within 20 High Performance Sport programs. QAS is looking for ONE OR TWO Sports Physician Registrars, Sports Physicians or General Practitioners with a special interest in Sports Medicine to provide performance medical support to sports programs listed below: Diving (19 athletes) Beach Volleyball (12 athletes) Contracts may be awarded to two practitioners (one for each sport) OR maybe combined and awarded to one practitioner, at the discretion of QAS.  Practitioners must have previous experience working in an Elite Sports Environment / High Performance Systems to be considered for this opportunity. Successful practitioner/s will be responsible for the support of athletes and liaison with coaches within the daily training environment to deliver a proactive model of care to optimise athlete health and performance. The primary location to perform Services will be the practitioner’s private practice (must be based in Brisbane). The practitioner may also be required to provide services at other locations (primarily in Brisbane), dependant on the requirements and training venue of the sport program(s). The initial contract term is from September 2023 to 28 February 2024, with an option to extend for a further 12 months till 28 February 2025 at the discretion of QAS. Note: Contract/s will be awarded to individual practitioners (registered as an organisation or sole traders) only. Sub-contracting arrangements through a company will not be considered. For detailed information on the specific services sought under this tender, please review the ITO Part B - Contract Details. Supliers are required to provdie the folloiwng for your appplication: Completed and signed Part C – ITO Response Schedule A current resume Copies of required insurance, qualifications, and registration etc

title: Library Public Internet Management
agency: Issued by Brisbane City Council
description: Brisbane City Council is seeking information from the market in order to establish the availability of a Library Public Internet Management solution that aligns with Council’s business requirements. The market survey invites Library Internet Management solution suppliers to describe their solution and further assist Council to identify the appropriate technologies and to gain a greater understanding of the technology option. High Level Business Requirements Brisbane City Council is interested in a SaaS solution with the ability to integrate with Council’s Library Management System (LMS), that will support a public Internet management booking system, local and remote printing, cashless payment options, hard disk protection solution, as well as reporting modules and remote support. This would include: Public Internet booking. Secure session and PC management. Integration with Council’s LMS (SirsiDynix). Printing services (including remote Mobile Printing). Payment options via EFT and cash. Reporting module for statistics. This Market survey is an informal activity designed to give Council an understanding  of the market, it’s suppliers and services, thereby allowing for refinement of the business case and specifications and assisting with determining the best procurement approach. Suplier are to note: Council is not seeking binding offers. Any discussions of cost are purely indicative. Impartiality and confidentiality will be maintained throughout the process All suppliers involved will be treated with fairness and equality. For detailed information on the specific goods / services sought under this tender, please review the attached Market Survey  Please return the completed survey to the following email: os-is-ictprojectsourcing@brisbane.qld.gov.au  by 2pm on Friday 18th August 2023. Any questions should also be directed to this email address.

title: 98 Birch St, Manunda - Cairns Neighbourhood Centre - Document and Construction - PQC Level 2
agency: Issued by Department of Energy and Public Works - QBuild - Far North Qld
description: Tenders please note: Services: Principal Contractor (Document and Construct) The Queensland Government through QBuild, a business unit of the Department of Energy and Public Works, invites suitably qualified contractors to submit an offer for:: Document and Construction of a new Neighbourhood Centre located at 98 Birch Street, Manunda Eligibility requires at a minimum the following: Appropriate QBCC Builders licence to undertake the entire scope of works Public Liability Insurance - Minimum of $20m Office located within the FNQ region Minimum Prequalification (PQC) System Level 2 ​Where a PQC level is stated, the Principal is not obliged to provide tender documents, consider or accept a tender unless the tenderer is appropriately registered under the Queensland Governments' PQC System for the PQC Level required (or higher) Tender documentation is available from the eTender website at https://etender.hpw.qld.gov.au/ Submissions are to electronic via the QBuild eTender site. The tender close date is Friday, 18th August 2023 at 14:00pm AEST

title: Expression of Interest - Soil & Agriculture Study for the Pioneer-Burdekin PHES - CONPNR0276EOI
agency: Issued by Queensland Hydro
description: Queensland Hydro is seeking Expressions of Interest for Soil and Agriculture Technical Studies to support of the Pioneer Burdekin Pumped Hydro Energy Storage (PHES) Project’s Detailed Analytical Report (DAR) and Environmental Impact Statement (EIS).   The purpose of this Expression of Interest (EOI) is to test the availability and capability of potential Suppliers (being the individual or Company submitting the EOI) to undertake the services as set out in the attached documents.  Where the Respondent demonstrates sufficient understanding, experience and capability to deliver the proposed services, that Respondent may subsequently be invited to lodge an Offer via a Select Request for Proposal (RFP).

title: Bulimba State School - Pool Services Renovations
agency: Issued by Department Of Education, Training and Employment
region: Building construction and support and maintenance and repair services - (50%)
description: The Department of Education (DoE) is inviting tenders for Principal Contractors to undertake the refurbishment works at Bulimba State School – 261 Oxford Street, Bulimba QLD 4171. Tender documentation is available for collection from Ridgemill Pty Ltd, by contacting Gerard O’Keeffe on telephone 0447 733 698 or email tenders@ridgemill.com.au for further information. Electronic tenders are to be submitted by 18 August 2023 at 2:00pm at tenders@ridgemill.com.au.   A site inspection has been arranged on Friday 28 July 2023 at 10:00am, at Bulimba State School, 261 Oxford Street, Bulimba QLD 4171. Meet at school Administration Building.   ## Please Note : PQC requirement is no longer required ##    The new and refurbishment scope of works within the school pool area will generally involve the following construction activities:- • Canteen Refurbishment • Amenities and Change Room Refurbishment • Storage Shelving to Chemical Store • New/Extension to Marshalling Area • New Pool Heating (Heat Pump) • Resurfacing existing pool deck with epoxy finish • Re-roofing of existing western & eastern grandstand • Replacement of eastern grandstand external cladding • Refurbishment of existing Pool Store

title: GeoSCADA Upgrades - Design & Construction
agency: Issued by Redland City Council
description: Redland City Council (RCC) is seeking a Principal Contractor to upgrade the existing Citect SCADA to GeoSCADA at five (5) of its Wastewater Treatment Plants at various locations across Redland City.  The work to be performed under this contract comprises design, materials, equipment, labour, and the performance of all operations necessary for the supply/delivery, installation, integration, configuration, construction, supervision, and certification of the proposed works/services, which include, but are not limited to, the following: Project Quality Management Citect SCADA & Page Review GeoSCADA Design & Implementation Hardware, Software & Licences Project Documentation Operating System Back-Ups Testing, Commissioning & Verification Site Support Training Please refer to the full tender package for further details.

title: Expression of Interest Note Domino Managed Service Provider
agency: Issued by Department of Transport and Main Roads - Information Technology Branch
description: The Department of Transport and Main Roads (TMR) is looking for a Managed Service Provider (MSP) to take over the management of its current Notes Domino environment including, management and support.  Delivering the Notes services back to TMR as a Notes applications and functionality transformation is undertaken.  TMR seeks responses from suitably experienced Managed Service Providers, preferably with Notes Domino experience, including approximate costings to fulfil the objectives. This is a Two stage Expression of Interest (EOI) procurement process.  Responses will be evaluated, resulting in a shortlisted number of Suppliers to progress to the next stage of the procurement process. Therefore, Failure to submit a response to this EOI will exclude Suppliers from being considered for any subsequent shortlisted procurement activity for this managed service requirement.  For detailed information on the specific services sought under this tender, please review the "Specification Documents"

agency: Issued by Department Of Education, Training and Employment

title: Expression of Interest Noise and Vibration Studies for Borumba and Pioneer Burdekin PHES CONGEN0211EOI
agency: Issued by Queensland Hydro
description: Queensland Hydro are inviting Suppliers to quote for the provision of Noise and Vibration Studies for the Pioneer-Burdekin and Borumba Pumped Hydro Energy Storage Project (PBPHES). The objective of this Expression of Interest (EOI)  is to assess the availability and capacity of  potential Suppliers (both Individuals or Companies submitting the EOI) to provide the required services. This will be followed by a Select  Request for Quote (RFQ) process, wherein Queensland Hydro aims to identify and contract with the most suitable Supplier to assist in supporting each PHES project. Description of the services to be carried out under this Contract include, but are not limited to: - Noise and Vibration Technical Reports for both projects in different phases (DAR and EIS) For detailed information on the specific goods / services sought under this EOI, please review the "Scope and Specifications" in "Section 3  of the Expresdion of Interest Part A - EOI Particulars.

title: Provision of Conveyancing of Deceased Persons under the Coroners Act 2003 (Qld) and Burial or Cremation Services of Deceased Persons under the Burials Assistance Act 1965 (Qld)
agency: Issued by Department of Justice and Attorney-General
description: Suppliers are invited by the The Department of Justice and Attorney-General (DJAG) to submit an offer to Standing Offer Arrangement (SOA) Invitation to Offer (ITO) DJAG 740.2223 Release 1, for the Provision of Conveyancing of Deceased Persons under the Coroners Act 2003 (Qld); and Burial or Cremation of Deceased Persons under the Burials Assistance Act 1965 (Qld), as specified in Pack D – SOA Details.                                                                                                                                             This opportunity relates to any of the Local Government Areas (LGA) listed below: Balonne Banana Barcaldine Barcoo Blackall-Tamboo Boulia Bulloo Central Highlands Charters Towers Cloncurry Diamantina Etheridge Flinders Goondiwindi Longreach Maranoa Mareeba McKinlay Mount Isa Murweh Paroo Quilpie Richmond Tablelands Western Downs Winton Woorabinda Please note further LGA Boundaries will be released through QTenders Release 2 and Release 3 later this year. For detailed information on the specific goods / services sought under this tender, please review the "Specification Documents" in "Section 3 - Here is the detail".

title: Mackay/Whitsunday District-Biodiversity Survey-Millennium to Carborough Overtaking Lanes
agency: Issued by Department of Transport and Main Roads - Central West - Program Delivery and Operations
description: .DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORT AND MAIN ROADS Mackay/Whitsunday District  Project No:  1197099 Contract Number: MWD-3009 Tenders are invited to tender for Biodiversity Survey-Millennium to Carborough Overtaking Lanes on road 33A (Peak Downs Highway Clermont-Nebo). Access to Tender Documentation Tenderers will have access to the documents via the BASeTender website (Building & Asset Services): https://www.hpw.qld.gov.au/bas/etender/ Tender Lodgement: Tenderers are advised that this is an electronic submission via the BASeTender Website: https://www.hpw.qld.gov.au/bas/etender.  Tenderers are reminded that electronic submissions cannot be received or uploaded after the Tender Close Time, and Tenderers should take into consideration the data upload duration when submitting their Offer. Tender Closing Time: 2:00pm Monday 21 August 2023 Tender Enquiries: Name: Ritesh Poudel Phone: (07) 4951 8510 / 0499 843 307 Email:  Ritesh.X.Poudel@tmr.qld.gov.au AND mackay.environment@tmr.qld.gov.au (preferred)

title: Supply of Project Engineer Services for the Awoonga Dam Solar Farm
agency: Issued by Gladstone Area Water Board
description: Gladstone Area Water Board is seeking Offers for Project Engineer Services for the Awoonga Dam Solar Farm.   For detailed information on the specific goods / services sought under this tender, please review the "Specification Documents" in "Section 3 - Here is the detail".

title: RTCQ 04/23 For the provision of Ready Mixed Concrete & Cementitious Products
agency: Issued by Department of Transport and Main Roads - RoadTek
description: RoadTek wishes to engage skilled contractors to supply Ready Mixed Concrete & Cementitious Products within the Central Queensland region for the period 2023 – 2025. This contract will be set up to ensure the supply of reliable resources with regards to quantities and compliance with Transport and Main Roads Specifications and technical Standards Projects will be at various locations within the RoadTek Central Queensland region requiring Provision of Ready Mixed Concrete & Cementitious Products. Engagement / supply will be on an intermittent basis to suit RoadTek’s civil works program and there will be no guarantee given on quantities of materials.
